trans-unit.source: Paints an area with a radial gradient.
A focal point defines the beginning of the gradient, and a circle defines the end point of the gradient.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.RadialGradientBrush> is similar in programming model to the <xref:System.Windows.Media.LinearGradientBrush>.
However, the linear gradient has a start and an end point to define the gradient vector, while the radial gradient has a circle, along with a focal point, to define the gradient behavior.
The circle defines the end point of the gradient.
In other words, a gradient stop at 1.0 defines the color at the circle's circumference.
The focal point defines the center of the gradient.
A gradient stop at 0.0 defines the color at the focal point.
The following image shows a rectangle filled with a radial gradient.
The radial gradient that goes from white to gray.
The outside circle represents the gradient circle while the red dot denotes the focal point.
This gradient has its <xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientBrush.SpreadMethod%2A> set to <xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientSpreadMethod.Pad>.
![A radial gradient with highlighted components](~/add/media/art-radialgradientfocalpoint.jpg "A radial gradient with highlighted components")
Radial gradient with a highlighted focal point
<xref:System.Windows.Media.RadialGradientBrush> objects are rendered using hardware acceleration on <xref:System.Windows.Media.RenderCapability.Tier%2A> 2 systems.
For more information about hardware tiers, see [Graphics Rendering Tiers](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/graphics-rendering-tiers.md).
Freezable Features

Because it inherits from the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> class, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.RadialGradientBrush> class provides several special features: <xref:System.Windows.Media.RadialGradientBrush> objects can be declared as , shared among multiple objects, made read-only to improve performance, cloned, and made thread safe.
For more information about the different features provided by <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects, see [Freezable Objects Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/freezable-objects-overview.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RadialGradientBrush"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RadialGradientBrush"></xref> class that has the specified gradient stops.
The gradient stops to set on this brush.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RadialGradientBrush"></xref> class with the specified start and stop colors.
Color value at the focus (<xref href="System.Windows.Media.RadialGradientBrush.GradientOrigin"></xref>) of the radial gradient.
Color value at the outer edge of the radial gradient.
Gets or sets the center of the outermost circle of the radial gradient.
The default central point location of the gradient circle is (0.5, 0.5).
The two-dimensional point located at the center of the radial gradient.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RadialGradientBrush.Center"></xref> dependency property.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RadialGradientBrush"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true.`
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RadialGradientBrush"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true`.
Gets or sets the location of the two-dimensional focal point that defines the beginning of the gradient.
The location of the two-dimensional focal point of the gradient.
The default is (0.5, 0.5).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RadialGradientBrush.GradientOrigin"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the horizontal radius of the outermost circle of the radial gradient.
The horizontal radius of the outermost circle of the radial gradient.
The default is 0.5.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RadialGradientBrush.RadiusX"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the vertical radius of the outermost circle of a radial gradient.
The vertical radius of the outermost circle of a radial gradient.
The default is 0.5.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RadialGradientBrush.RadiusY"></xref> dependency property.
